turns.speaker: APPLEJACK
turns.text: We're going too slow. It looks like we're following him.

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: Mr. Henry pulled that job in 1965. It's famous. Applejack was the wheel man. Did you use this same car, Applejack?

turns.speaker: APPLEJACK
turns.text: Hell, no. This is a '72. I was driving a '63 Pontiac.

turns.speaker: APPLEJACK
turns.text: I don't know why the fuck we're having a party. The damn job's not over yet.

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: Well, this isn't really a party per se.

turns.speaker: APPLEJACK
turns.text: You don't celebrate til it's over.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: Dignan and Anthony, this is Little Richard. He's crazy. Totally nuts.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: Little Richard. Trust me. You're insane. Jesus, this guy used to carry a percussion bomb around in his trunk. You do not want a guy like that loose on the streets.

turns.speaker: LITTLE RICHARD
turns.text: It seemed like a good idea at the time.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: The one and only Little Richard.

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: I don't know, Bob. What about one of those?

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: I'm not allowed to drive those.

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: I thought your parents were in Italy.

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: He looks like he was designed by scientists. For desert warfare.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: If you're that worried, maybe we should just steal one.

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: What are you talking about, Bob?

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: Well. What do you want to do? You want to steal one or just drive your car?

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: How much could you grow? Realistically.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: As much as I want. When these plants bud I'll probably have about six thousand dollars worth of weed.

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: Six thousand dollars? Come on, Bob.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: You should take a look. I have an entire crop in my backyard.

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: If it's that easy why doesn't everybody grow them?

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: Don't you guys tell anybody about my plants.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: I can't believe you said that.

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: You said it like it was a big joke, Bob. Like he's wild.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: No, I was saying crazy like a lunatic.

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: I know that now. He's a fucking psycho.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: Well, don't blame me. I told you.

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: I do blame you, Bob. And woah. Look at her.

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: I think we might of scared her.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: I'm going to take a look at this.

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: Hang on. This is important, Bob. Anthony and I are responsible for the internal situation. The money and the people. You're responsible for the external situation. The streets and the getaway.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: I'm paying attention. I just want to look at it for a minute.

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: What's your fucking problem? You're a shithead!

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: I just want to see how much bullets it takes.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: He doesn't get it. Held never understand what we're trying to accomplish here. It's too dangerous for him.

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: Well, in reality it's not that dangerous, Bob. It's only dangerous if you don't know what you're doing.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: Yeah, but what if some nut pulled gun on you?

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: You know, Bob, Anthony did kill someone. He electrocuted our janitor senior year.

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: It was an accidental. I don't want to go into the details. It was just one of those senior pranks that didn't really go right. I mean, obviously, since Swifty's dead. That's why Anthony never graduated.

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: Yeah. One of the nicest old guys you'd ever know.

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: You know, when somebody gets electrocuted, their skin starts smoking. At least Swifty's did.

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: I'm putting a piece of tape on my nose.

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: Shhh. Slow down, Bob. Drive natural.

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: That's good. Keep it at forty.

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: Be cool, Bob. Be cool.  Make that light.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: Was Dignan screaming like, Get me a bag!

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: You really think he'll remember you?

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: No. All he'll remember is a guy with a piece of tape on his nose.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: I don't want to talk about it.

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: I mean, Jesus Christ, Bob. You didn't have some vicious lunatic screaming, "I'm going to remember you!"

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: That's true. That would give me nightmares.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: I told you they were there.

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: In all probability nothing would of happened. But why take the chance? That's why I ran. I mean how many plants were even back there? Five? Ten?

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: Shit, Bob. What the fuck did you do that for?

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: I'm sure he did. We'll have to get new plates.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: It's registered in my mother's name.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: You're the one who kept saying ram him.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: See you in a little while.

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: But it's not his. How can they arrest Future Man?

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: They said he's a drug dealer.

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: I don't think they can make it stick, Bob. I mean, what do they actually have on Future Man?

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: Well, the marijuana crop is a good start.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: They also found my two beam scale in the garage.

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: Since when is it a crime to have a scale in your house? Everybody has a scale.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: The cops say it's a special kind of scale drug dealers use in selling marijuana.

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: So tell them the truth. What do you use it for?

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: I was just going to use it to see how much I had.

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: How long has he been in there?

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: Then how come they haven't set the bail yet? That's unconstitutional.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: We'll have to see when we get back.

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: What do you mean get back?

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: Well, obviously, we got to go back.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: Dignan, he's my brother. I can't just leave him there.

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: Not in that car you're not.

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: Good luck, since I got the keys.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: Dignan. You're going to give me those keys or you're going to get hurt.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: Goddammit, Dignan! It's my car! If you don't give me my keys, I swear to God --

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: Future Man would never go to jail for you, I'll tell you that.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: His name's not Future Man, Dignan.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: You don't even know his name.

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: Just get in the car, Bob.

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: OK, Bob. I don't know his name. You know why? Because I don't care. He's Future Man. But I care about you. And to me it doesn't make sense to go back to the scene of a crime. Will you get in the car, Bob? This is stupid.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: It's not your decision and he's not your brother, Dignan.

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: That's right. I only have one vote. We'll go talk with Anthony and figure it out.

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: You've got a beautiful walk, Bob.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: Come on in. What you been up to?

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: It's too bad about what happened on the road.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: I don't expect an apology and I don't even want one. I just want us to --

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: I can't fucking believe this guy. An apology, Bob?

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: Man, I don't want to go into this.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: I don't want to fight you, Dignan.

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: It wasn't your fault, Bob. You had your brother.

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: Look. We want you on the job.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: I know it, man. Hang on.

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: Yeah. We're in the elevator. How's it look back there?

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: It looks pretty good. There's nobody back here.

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: Who's watching the door? What the fuck are you doing? Get back in position.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: He's having a heart attack or something.

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: Jesus Christ. What the fuck is that?

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: I didn't think there was an alarm.

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: Take him to the car, Bob.

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: I said to the DA, That cop who hit me must of given me CRS disease.

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: That's just what the DA asked. CRS is a disease where you can't remember shit.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: Do you have your own room?

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: We don't have rooms, Bob. We have cells.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: Do you have your own cell?

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: No. I have a cellmate. His name's Carl.

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: I don't really want to talk about it, Bob.

turns.speaker: FUTURE MAN
turns.text: Hard to find it sitting by the pool drinking beer and bullshitting.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: John, I'm twenty-six years old I didn't run away from home.

turns.speaker: FUTURE MAN
turns.text: I know, Bob. You were on a secret mission.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: I'd appreciate it if you didn't go around telling people lies about me.

turns.speaker: FUTURE MAN
turns.text: Right. I'm sorry.  You've got a reputation to think about.

turns.speaker: JACKSON
turns.text: This boy's a troublemaker. He used to tear this place apart.

turns.speaker: JACKSON
turns.text: Your brother was up here the other day. He said you ran away from home.

turns.speaker: JACKSON
turns.text: He said you ran away from home.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: No. I didn't run away. I went out of town.

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: How long do you have to go?

turns.speaker: MR. HENRY
turns.text: Dignan. Good to see you. Good to see you Applejack.  Who are you?

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: This is Anthony Adams, Mr. Henry.

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: I don't know. Are you in, Anthony?

turns.speaker: MR. HENRY
turns.text: The basic grammatical rules of robbing.

turns.speaker: MR. HENRY
turns.text: Crowd control. Crowd control. Wake up, guys.

turns.speaker: MR. HENRY
turns.text: You're going to need a boxman for this one. But that can be arranged.

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: We're just going over a few things.

turns.speaker: MR. HENRY
turns.text: You got to have fun with it. There's no point if you're not having any fun. Would you like me to be there tomorrow?

turns.speaker: MR. HENRY
turns.text: No, if I go out on this job, then it's just another score by Mr. Henry. And I don't see it like that. This is your job. Your creation. I want you to try this.

turns.speaker: KUMAR
turns.text: Why did he go that way?

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: He's going to watch the back stairwell, remember?  Don't worry about it.

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: Well, I left some money in there.

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: In the cash register. Step away from the door.

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: Where is he? Where is Rob?

turns.speaker: EMPLOYEE
turns.text: I don't know. Maybe in literature. That's his section.

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: Hello, my friend. You in the Army, yes?

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: No. I just have short hair.

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: Where's your friend? He go with the chiquita?

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: She is a good looking woman.

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: Si. Tecate. You like to fight?

turns.speaker: FUTURE MAN
turns.text: John Mapplethorpe.  How are you. Hi.

turns.speaker: MR. HENRY
turns.text: The world needs dreamers. To relieve the pain of consciousness.

turns.speaker: FUTURE MAN
turns.text: Well, we'll see you later, Bob.

turns.speaker: ABBOTT
turns.text: You told me Bourne was dead.

turns.speaker: ABBOTT
turns.text: I'll say. You killed his goddam girlfriend instead. Now they're onto Neski. They're at the Brecker Hotel even as we speak.

turns.speaker: GRETKOV
turns.text: Will it track back to us?

turns.speaker: ABBOTT
turns.text: No. The files are spotless. Whatever they find, it's just going to make Conklin look worse.

turns.speaker: ABBOTT
turns.text: She's done everything I wanted. She bit on Conklin so fast it was laughable. She even found his bogus Swiss account...

turns.speaker: ABBOTT
turns.text: Neski was a roadblock. Without me, there's no company, no fortune. You owe me, Uri. One last push.

turns.speaker: GRETKOV
turns.text: Leaving was a business decision. We're both rich, come enjoy it.

turns.speaker: GRETKOV
turns.text: Go to the airport. Get a plane. I'll have a brass band waiting for you.

turns.speaker: ABBOTT
turns.text: He left yesterday on the night train. He's probably just getting in now.  You'll have to hurry.
